reviews.text: Amazing place for spending a great evening. Picnics, Cycling, or just relaxing.. this is a wonderful place from where you can view the city skylines. I appreciate the Govt. building such a freely accessible place for the people.

The place is spacious, it's a good place to chill, hangout with friends and family, most people picnic here, bring food, take pictures, there are seats on the edge near the jogging track.

I suggest coming at 5 am because yesterday at 4 am it was still quite hot. Yesterday I came when it was raining so it was a bit humid.

Plus point, near MRT so it's convenient for tourists. I would recommend people to come here if you have no where else to go.

I visited Marina Barrage on a Sunday morning at 8 AM, and it was already lively with many people setting up their picnics on the rooftop. The vast green space is perfect for laying down a picnic mat and enjoying the fresh air. However, I highly recommend bringing your own food or buying it beforehand since there are very few options available nearby.

One of the best things about Marina Barrage is the open and spacious environment, making it ideal for families, joggers, and even pet owners. Kids can run around freely, and it's a fantastic place to fly kitesâ€”I saw many families enjoying this activity! The wind conditions are usually great, making kite flying effortless and fun.

Beyond picnicking, the panoramic views of the city skyline and Marina Bay Sands add to the charm, creating a beautiful backdrop for photos. The cool morning breeze makes it even more enjoyable, especially before the sun gets too strong later in the day.

It's a great place to watch the sunrise. Can see the sun rising from the equtor. It's a great experience. It's not a high observatory, but there are no buildings blocking the view, so you can see an open view. The winding road leading up to the observatory is also really unique. You can see the water gate blocking the seawater entering Marina Bay. If you cross the bridge here, you can go all the way to the East Coast, so it's a popular place for cyclists.

This place offers a stunning view, especially in the late afternoon as the sun begins to set. Staff were also helpful & informative, they even gave us heads-up before it started to rain which showed they really care about visitorsâ€™ safety ðŸŒ†
